ground_truth: Elliot takes a last drag on his cigarette, and the camera follows his hand as he crushes it out in a nearby ashtray. Hare Krishna music is heard over a sunlit view of the Manhattan skyline and the green trees of Central Park. The camera moves down to reveal a large group of Hare Krishnas dancing on the broad green lawn among other New Yorkers enjoying the day. The leader, holding some pamphlets, stands by a chain-link fence a few feet away from his group, talking to someone on the other side. It's Mickey, as the camera soon shows, wearing a short-sleeved shirt, a paper tucked under his arm. Mickey walks off, the Hare Krishnas still dancing and singing on the other side of the fence. He flips through the literature as he walks, then looks straight ahead, pondering. Mickey puts his hand to his mouth as another title appears on a black screen. A bench faces some wharf pilings; the water gently laps against them as Lee walks into view, the wind blowing her hair. She stands and faces the water and the distant skyline across the bay. Lee is alone; her hands are in her pockets. The concerto stops, and the movie cuts to Holly, leaning into an open phone booth near a subway entrance. People rush past Holly towards the subway; others are walking up the station steps. Holly smokes a cigarette as she talks on the phone to Hannah. Holly hangs up the phone and takes a drag on her cigarette. She looks off in the distance, smiling, as the film cuts to guests crowded together in the living room, surrounding the piano, where Evan is sitting and flipping through some sheet music. Norma stands behind him, leaning against a book-laden wall. The guests are chattering, enjoying themselves; a lamp glows on the corner of the piano. A little boy sitting in a chair next to Evan is talking animatedly with a girl who is leaning over the arm of the sofa. An adult guest talks to the little boy; another guest takes a sip of wine from a glass she'd placed on the bookshelf behind her as Evan turns and addresses the group. The guests laugh appreciatively. A woman comes over to Evan and hands him some wine. He laughs; the guests laugh with him. The guests continue to laugh; they are charmed. Evan continues to laugh with everyone as he starts to play the piano. A nearby woman toasts him with her drink. The camera moves around the room as he plays, showing the various guests, chattering over the music. Some are in clusters, in private conversations; others listen and watch the offscreen Evan.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a last drag on his cigarette, and his hand is followed by the camera as a nearby ashtray is used by him to crush it out. Over a sunlit view of the Manhattan skyline and the green trees of Central Park, Hare Krishna music plays. To reveal a large group of Hare Krishnas dancing on the broad green lawn among other New Yorkers enjoying the day, the camera moves down. By a chain-link fence a few feet away from his group, the leader, holding some pamphlets, stands talking to someone on the other side. As the camera soon shows, it's Mickey, wearing a short-sleeved shirt, a paper tucked under his arm. Off Mickey walks, while the Hare Krishnas still dance and sing on the other side of the fence. As he walks, the literature is flipped through by him, then he looks straight ahead, pondering. His hand is put to his mouth by Mickey as another title appears on a black screen. Facing some wharf pilings; a bench is framed by the water gently lapping against them as Lee walks into view, with the wind blowing her hair. She stands and faces the water and the distant skyline across the bay. Alone is Lee; her hands are in her pockets. The concerto is stopped, and the movie cuts to Holly, leaning into an open phone booth near a subway entrance. Towards the subway, people rush past Holly; others walk up the station steps. On the phone to Hannah, Holly smokes a cigarette. The phone is hung up by Holly, and she takes a drag on her cigarette. Off in the distance, she looks, smiling, as the film cuts to guests crowded together in the living room, surrounding the piano, where Evan is sitting and flipping through some sheet music. Behind him, leaning against a book-laden wall, stands Norma. The guests chatter, enjoying themselves; on the corner of the piano, a lamp glows. Animatedly, a little boy sitting in a chair next to Evan talks with a girl who leans over the arm of the sofa. To the little boy, an adult guest talks; another guest, from a glass she'd placed on the bookshelf behind her, takes a sip of wine as the group is addressed by Evan. Appreciatively, the guests laugh. Over to Evan, a woman comes and hands him some wine. He laughs; with him, the guests laugh. The guests continue to laugh; they are charmed. With everyone, Evan continues to laugh as he starts to play the piano. To him, a nearby woman toasts with her drink. Around the room, the camera moves as he plays, showing the various guests, who chatter over the music. In clusters, some are in private conversations; others listen and watch the offscreen Evan.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a final drag on his cigarette and crushes it in an ashtray. Hare Krishna music accompanies a sunlit Manhattan skyline and Central Park view. The camera reveals Hare Krishnas dancing on the lawn with New Yorkers. The leader, holding pamphlets, stands by a fence talking to Mickey, who wears a short-sleeved shirt with a paper under his arm. Mickey walks off, flipping through literature and pondering. He puts a hand to his mouth as a new title appears. Lee stands alone by the water, facing the distant skyline. The concerto stops, cutting to Holly in a phone booth near a subway. People rush past; she smokes, talking to Hannah. Holly hangs up, smiling. The scene cuts to a crowded living room with guests around a piano. Evan flips through sheet music as Norma leans against a book-laden wall. Guests chatter, enjoying themselves, a lamp glowing on the piano. A little boy talks to a girl on the sofa; an adult speaks to him, another guest sips wine. Evan addresses the group, making them laugh. A woman gives him wine, prompting more laughter. Evan plays the piano, guests toast and chatter. Some are in private conversations; others watch Evan offscreen.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a final drag on his cigarette and crushes it in an ashtray. Hare Krishna music plays over a sunlit Manhattan skyline and Central Park. The camera reveals Hare Krishnas dancing on the lawn among New Yorkers. The leader, with pamphlets, talks to Mickey through a fence. Mickey, in a short-sleeved shirt, reads the pamphlet while walking, pondering. He puts his hand to his mouth as a title appears on a black screen. Lee walks to a wharf, facing water and skyline, alone with hands in pockets. The concerto ends; Holly leans into a phone booth by a subway, talking to Hannah and smoking. She hangs up, smiles, and the scene cuts to guests in a living room around Evan at a piano. Norma leans against a book-laden wall. Guests chatter and laugh. A boy talks to a girl on the sofa arm. A guest drinks wine as Evan addresses the group; laughter follows. A woman gives Evan wine, and laughter continues. Evan plays the piano, and a woman toasts him. The camera shows guests chatting and listening to Evan.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Elliot takes a final, lingering drag on his cigarette, savoring the moment, before the camera pans to follow his hand with deliberate focus as he carefully crushes it out in a nearby ashtray. Accompanying this action, the soothing sounds of Hare Krishna music gently play over a sunlit, breathtaking view of the iconic Manhattan skyline, contrasted with the lush, green trees of Central Park in the foreground. As the camera gracefully shifts its angle downward, it unveils a large, vibrant group of Hare Krishnas joyfully dancing on the expansive, green lawn amidst other New Yorkers who are also out enjoying the beautiful day. Meanwhile, the group’s leader, who is holding an assortment of pamphlets, stands casually by a chain-link fence just a few feet away from his group, engaged in a conversation with someone on the other side. As the camera soon reveals, it's Mickey, dressed in a short-sleeved shirt and with a paper tucked neatly under his arm. Mickey then walks away, while the Hare Krishnas continue their spirited dancing and singing on the opposite side of the fence. As he strolls, Mickey absentmindedly flips through the literature in his hand, then looks straight ahead, deep in thought and pondering. He raises his hand to his mouth just as another title appears on a stark black screen. 

In another part of the story, a solitary bench faces a collection of wharf pilings, with the water gently lapping against them, creating a serene backdrop as Lee makes her entrance into the scene, her hair tousled by the gentle breeze. She stands there, facing the water and the distant, shimmering skyline across the bay. Lee is alone in this moment; her hands buried deep in her pockets. The concerto that has been playing comes to a stop, and the movie seamlessly transitions to Holly, who is leaning into an open phone booth situated near the entrance to a bustling subway. People hurry past Holly, rushing towards the subway, while others ascend the station steps. As she talks on the phone to Hannah, Holly smokes a cigarette, her expression relaxed. After hanging up the phone, she takes another drag from her cigarette and gazes off into the distance, a smile playing on her lips, as the film transitions once more. 

Now, the scene shifts to a lively gathering of guests who are crowded together in a cozy living room, surrounding a piano where Evan is seated, engrossed in flipping through some sheet music. Norma stands just behind him, leaning casually against a wall filled with books. The guests are chattering away, clearly enjoying themselves; a lamp casts a warm glow on the corner of the piano, adding to the inviting atmosphere. A little boy, sitting in a chair next to Evan, engages in an animated conversation with a girl who is leaning over the arm of a nearby sofa. An adult guest converses with the little boy while another guest takes a delicate sip of wine from a glass she had placed on the bookshelf behind her, as Evan turns to address the group. The guests respond with appreciative laughter. A woman makes her way over to Evan and hands him some wine, prompting him to laugh, and the guests join in, sharing the moment. The guests continue to laugh, clearly charmed by the occasion. Evan, still laughing, begins to play the piano, and a nearby woman raises her drink in a toast to him. The camera moves fluidly around the room as Evan plays, capturing the various guests who are chattering amidst the music. Some are gathered in clusters, engaged in private conversations, while others simply listen and watch the unseen Evan perform.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Elliot takes a final, lingering drag on his cigarette, savoring the fleeting moment, before the camera pans with deliberate focus to follow his hand as he carefully, and with methodical precision, crushes it out in a nearby ashtray. Accompanying this precise action, the soothing and melodic sounds of Hare Krishna music gently play over a sunlit, breathtaking view of the iconic Manhattan skyline. This panoramic skyline is strikingly contrasted with the lush, vibrant green trees of Central Park, which stand prominently in the foreground. As the camera gracefully shifts its angle downward, it unveils a large, vibrant group of Hare Krishnas who are joyously dancing on the expansive, green lawn amidst the other New Yorkers who are also out enjoying the beautiful day. Meanwhile, the group’s leader, holding an array of colorful pamphlets, stands casually by a chain-link fence, just a few feet away from his group, as he engages in a conversation with someone on the opposite side of the fence. As the camera soon reveals, it's Mickey, dressed comfortably in a short-sleeved shirt, with a paper neatly tucked under his arm. Mickey then walks away, while the Hare Krishnas continue their spirited and lively dancing and singing on the opposite side of the fence. As he strolls leisurely, Mickey absentmindedly flips through the literature in his hand, then looks straight ahead, deep in thought and pondering. He raises his hand to his mouth just as another title appears, starkly displayed on a black screen.

In another segment of the story, a solitary bench is positioned to face a collection of wharf pilings, with the water gently lapping against them, creating a serene and peaceful backdrop as Lee makes her entrance into the scene, her hair tousled by the gentle breeze. She stands there, facing the water and the distant, shimmering skyline that stretches across the bay. Lee is alone in this moment; her hands are buried deep within her pockets. The concerto that has accompanied the scene comes to a stop, and the movie seamlessly transitions to Holly, who is leaning into an open phone booth situated conveniently near the entrance to a bustling subway station. People hurry past Holly, rushing eagerly towards the subway, while others are seen ascending the station steps. As she talks on the phone to Hannah, Holly smokes a cigarette, her expression relaxed and calm. After hanging up the phone, she takes another thoughtful drag from her cigarette and gazes off into the distance, a gentle smile playing on her lips, as the film transitions once more.

Now, the scene shifts to a lively gathering of guests, who are crowded together in a cozy living room that is centered around a piano where Evan is seated. He is engrossed in flipping through some intricate sheet music. Norma stands just behind him, leaning casually against a wall filled with books that add to the room's inviting ambiance. The guests are chattering away, clearly enjoying themselves; a lamp casts a warm and comforting glow on the corner of the piano, enhancing the inviting atmosphere. A little boy, sitting in a chair next to Evan, is engaged in an animated conversation with a girl who is leaning over the arm of a nearby sofa. An adult guest converses with the little boy while another guest takes a delicate sip of wine from a glass that she had placed on the bookshelf behind her, as Evan turns to address the group. The guests respond with appreciative and genuine laughter. A woman makes her way over to Evan and hands him a glass of wine, prompting him to laugh, and the guests join in, sharing in the delightful moment. The guests continue to laugh, clearly charmed by the pleasant occasion. Evan, still laughing, begins to play the piano, and a nearby woman raises her drink in a toast to him. The camera moves fluidly around the room as Evan plays, capturing the various guests who are chattering amidst the harmonious music. Some are gathered in intimate clusters, engaged in private conversations, while others simply listen attentively and watch the unseen Evan perform.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a slow and deliberate last drag on his cigarette, savoring the moment, before the camera, closely following his hand's motion, captures him crushing the cigarette out in a nearby ashtray with a firm twist. Meanwhile, Hare Krishna music gently fills the air, accompanying a sunlit and sweeping view of the majestic Manhattan skyline, with the vibrant greenery of Central Park contrasting against the urban backdrop. The camera gracefully moves downwards to reveal a vivid scene where a large group of Hare Krishnas, resplendent in their traditional attire, are energetically dancing on the expansive green lawn, surrounded by various New Yorkers who are out and about, enjoying the lively day. The leader of the Hare Krishnas, holding a handful of pamphlets, stands a few feet away from his group near a chain-link fence, engaged in a conversation with someone on the opposite side of the fence. As the camera's focus sharpens, it reveals Mickey, dressed casually in a short-sleeved shirt with a folded paper tucked securely under his arm, who listens intently before deciding to walk away, leaving behind the enthusiastic Hare Krishnas still immersed in their dancing and singing. As he ambles off, Mickey nonchalantly flips through the pamphlet in his hand, his eyes scanning the pages, before he directs his gaze straight ahead, lost in a contemplative thought. He thoughtfully raises his hand to his mouth, the film momentarily shifting to another scene, transitioning smoothly to a title appearing on a black screen. This new scene opens by showing a bench strategically facing some aged wharf pilings, with the rhythmic, gentle lapping of the water against them creating a serene ambiance. Lee enters the frame, her hair tousled gracefully by the wind, and she pauses to stand facing the expansive water, her gaze stretching towards the distant skyline visible across the bay. In this tranquil moment, Lee is alone, her hands comfortably nestled in her pockets, as she takes in the peaceful scenery around her. The background concerto music comes to a stop, seamlessly ushering in a new scene that cuts to Holly, who is seen leaning into an open phone booth conveniently situated near a bustling subway entrance. The throng of people, characterized by hurried movements, rush past Holly, eagerly descending into the subway, while others steadily ascend the station steps. Holly, multitasking with a cigarette poised between her fingers, converses animatedly on the phone, engaging in a dialogue with Hannah on the other end. The conversation concludes as Holly hangs up the receiver with a definitive click, then takes another contemplative drag on her cigarette. Her eyes drift off into the distance, a smile subtly spreading across her face as the film transitions to a crowded living room scene. Guests are huddled together in animated clusters around a piano where Evan is seated, methodically flipping through an assortment of sheet music. Norma stands observantly behind him, casually leaning against a wall lined with books. The room buzzes with chatter, filled with guests enjoying themselves in a warm, convivial atmosphere, accentuated by the gentle glow of a lamp resting on the corner of the piano. Nearby, a little boy sitting comfortably in a chair engages in an animated conversation with a girl who playfully leans over the arm of the sofa, while an adult guest leans in to talk to the little boy. In another corner, a guest lifts a glass of wine, taking a refined sip before returning it to the bookshelf behind her as Evan turns to address the gathering. His words and demeanor elicit a wave of appreciative laughter from the guests. A woman approaches Evan, graciously handing him a glass of wine, prompting a shared moment of laughter between him and the assemblage. The room resonates with laughter, as the guests remain charmed and entertained. Amidst the joviality, Evan begins to play the piano, drawing a nearby woman to raise her drink in a toast to him. The camera gracefully pans around the room, capturing the different guests who are either engaged in private conversations within small clusters or attentively listening to and watching Evan as he plays, all while the background music softly permeates the air.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a final drag on his cigarette and extinguishes it in a nearby ashtray. The camera captures the sunlit Manhattan skyline and Central Park's greenery, accompanied by Hare Krishna music. Panning down, it reveals a large group of Hare Krishnas dancing on the lawn amidst other New Yorkers. The group's leader stands by a chain-link fence, talking to Mickey, who holds a paper under his arm. Mickey walks away, flipping through pamphlets and pondering as the Hare Krishnas continue their singing and dancing. A scene transition shows Lee standing alone by the water, facing the skyline across the bay with her hands in her pockets, wind blowing her hair. The film shifts to Holly at an open phone booth near a subway entrance, smoking while talking to Hannah. After hanging up, she gazes into the distance, smiling. The scene changes to a lively living room gathering around a piano with Evan browsing sheet music. Norma leans against a wall, surrounded by chatting guests. A little boy animatedly converses with a girl while an adult joins them. A guest sips wine as Evan engages the group, drawing laughter. A woman hands him wine, prompting more shared laughter. Evan begins playing the piano, and a woman toasts him; the camera captures guests in conversation or enjoying the music, forming clusters or quietly listening.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a last drag on his cigarette, a brand favored among New Yorkers for its bold flavor, and the camera follows his hand as he crushes it out in a nearby ashtray, once a common fixture in urban spaces before smoking bans. Hare Krishna music, known for its rhythmic devotionals, is heard over a sunlit view of the Manhattan skyline, iconic for its towering skyscrapers like the Empire State Building, and the green trees of Central Park, an urban oasis designed by Frederick Law Olmsted. The camera moves down to reveal a large group of Hare Krishnas, followers of a movement originating from the Gaudiya Vaishnavism tradition of Hinduism, dancing on the broad green lawn among other New Yorkers enjoying the day. The leader, holding some pamphlets about spirituality and peace, stands by a chain-link fence a few feet away from his group, talking to someone on the other side. It's Mickey, as the camera soon shows, wearing a short-sleeved shirt suited for the warm weather, a paper tucked under his arm, perhaps the New York Times, known for its comprehensive coverage of daily events. Mickey walks off, the Hare Krishnas still dancing and singing on the other side of the fence, their mantra spreading through the air. He flips through the literature as he walks, then looks straight ahead, pondering the philosophies presented. Mickey puts his hand to his mouth, deep in thought, as another title appears on a black screen. A bench faces some wharf pilings, remnants of New York's bustling shipping industry; the water gently laps against them as Lee walks into view, the wind from the bay blowing her hair. She stands and faces the water and the distant skyline across the bay, where the Statue of Liberty stands as a beacon of freedom. Lee is alone; her hands are in her pockets, perhaps contemplating the vastness before her. The concerto, an orchestral composition of emotional depth, stops, and the movie cuts to Holly, leaning into an open phone booth near a subway entrance, where commuters hustle through the city's vast transit system. People rush past Holly towards the subway; others are walking up the station steps, carrying the rhythm of the city's pulse. Holly smokes a cigarette, a moment of pause amidst the urban chaos, as she talks on the phone to Hannah. Holly hangs up the phone and takes a drag on her cigarette. She looks off in the distance, smiling, as the film cuts to guests crowded together in the living room, surrounding the piano, where Evan is sitting and flipping through some sheet music, perhaps preparing a piece by a classical composer such as Bach or Beethoven. Norma stands behind him, leaning against a book-laden wall, suggesting a love for literature. The guests are chattering, enjoying themselves; a lamp glows on the corner of the piano, casting a warm light over the scene. A little boy sitting in a chair next to Evan is talking animatedly with a girl who is leaning over the arm of the sofa, their conversation full of childhood curiosity. An adult guest talks to the little boy; another guest takes a sip of wine from a glass she'd placed on the bookshelf behind her as Evan turns and addresses the group. The guests laugh appreciatively, the room filled with camaraderie. A woman comes over to Evan and hands him some wine, a gesture of goodwill. He laughs; the guests laugh with him, sharing in the moment. The guests continue to laugh; they are charmed by the evening's conviviality. Evan continues to laugh with everyone as he starts to play the piano, filling the room with melodies. A nearby woman toasts him with her drink, celebrating the night. The camera moves around the room as he plays, showing the various guests, who are chattering over the music, some reminiscing about past memories, others forming new connections. Some are in clusters, in private conversations, while others listen and watch the offscreen Evan, captivated by his performance.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a last drag on his cigarette and the camera follows his hand as he crushes it out in a nearby ashtray. Hare Krishna music is heard over a sunlit view of the Manhattan skyline and the green trees of Central Park. The camera moves down to reveal a large group of Hare Krishnas dancing on the broad green lawn among other New Yorkers enjoying the day. The leader holding some pamphlets stands by a chainlink fence a few feet away from his group talking to someone on the other side. It is Mickey as the camera soon shows wearing a shortsleeved shirt a paper tucked under his arm. Mickey walks off the Hare Krishnas still dancing and singing on the other side of the fence. He flips through the literature as he walks then looks straight ahead pondering. Mickey puts his hand to his mouth as another title appears on a black screen. A bench faces some wharf pilings the water gently laps against them as Lee walks into view the wind blowing her hair. She stands and faces the water and the distant skyline across the bay. Lee is alone. her hands are in her pockets. The concerto stops and the movie cuts to Holly leaning into an open phone booth near a subway entrance. People rush past Holly towards the subway. others are walking up the station steps. Holly smokes a cigarette as she talks on the phone to Hannah. Holly hangs up the phone and takes a drag on her cigarette. She looks off in the distance smiling as the film cuts to guests crowded together in the living room surrounding the piano where Evan is sitting and flipping through some sheet music. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. Norma stands behind him leaning against a bookladen wall. The guests are chattering enjoying themselves. a lamp glows on the corner of the piano. A little boy sitting in a chair next to Evan is talking animatedly with a girl who is leaning over the arm of the sofa. An adult guest talks to the little boy. another guest takes a sip of wine from a glass she would placed on the bookshelf behind her as Evan turns and addresses the group. The guests laugh appreciatively. A woman comes over to Evan and hands him some wine. He laughs. the guests laugh with him. The guests continue to laugh. they are charmed. Evan continues to laugh with everyone as he starts to play the piano. A nearby woman toasts him with her drink. The camera moves around the room as he plays showing the various guests chattering over the music. Some are in clusters in private conversations. others listen and watch the offscreen. Evan.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption

The camera drifts down to expose a large group of Hare Krishnas lounging on the broad green lawn among other New Yorkers observing the day. The leader, clutching some pamphlets, leans against a chain-link fence a few feet away from his group, listening to someone on the other side. It's Mickey, as the camera soon observes, wearing a short-sleeved shirt, a paper balanced under his arm. Mickey strolls off, the Hare Krishnas still lounging and humming on the other side of the fence. He flicks through the literature as he strolls, then gazes straight ahead, daydreaming. Mickey brushes his hand through his hair as another title flashes on a black screen. A bench overlooks some wharf pilings; the water gently splashes against them as Lee steps into view, the wind waving her hair. She pauses and gazes at the water and the distant skyline across the bay. Lee is alone; her hands are in her pockets. The concerto fades, and the movie transitions to Holly, crouching into an open phone booth near a subway entrance. People dash past Holly towards the subway; others are climbing up the station steps. Holly stubs a cigarette as she chats on the phone to Hannah. Holly hangs up the phone and exhales smoke from her cigarette. She glances into the distance, beaming, as the film transitions to guests huddled together in the living room, encircling the piano, where Evan is seated and leafing through some sheet music. Norma loiters behind him, leaning against a book-laden wall. The guests are chatting, amusing themselves; a lamp flickers on the corner of the piano. A little boy sitting in a chair next to Evan is gesturing animatedly with a girl who is reclined over the arm of the sofa. An adult guest gestures to the little boy; another guest takes a sip of wine from a glass she'd rested on the bookshelf behind her as Evan spins and comments on the group. The guests cheer appreciatively. A woman approaches Evan and presents him with some wine. He chuckles; the guests chuckle with him. The guests persist in chuckling; they are amused. Evan continues to chuckle with everyone as he begins to play the piano. A nearby woman salutes him with her drink. The camera glides around the room as he plays, showcasing the various guests, chatting over the music. Some are in clusters, in private discussions; others listen and observe the offscreen Evan.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Ian takes a last sip from his soda, and the toaster follows his foot as he kicks it into a nearby trash can. Jazz music is heard over a cloudy view of the San Francisco skyline and the blue waters of the Mississippi River. The toaster moves down to reveal a small group of mimes performing on the narrow sandy beach among other tourists enjoying the evening. The director, holding some balloons, stands by a wooden bench a few inches away from his troupe, talking to someone on the other side. It's Fiona, as the toaster soon shows, wearing a long-sleeved jacket, a book tucked under her arm. Fiona skips away, the mimes still performing and gesturing on the other side of the bench. She flips through the sketches as she skips, then looks straight ahead, contemplating. Fiona puts her foot to her chin as another name appears on a red screen. A statue faces some rocky cliffs; the wind gently whistles against them as Jordan skips into view, the rain soaking her scarf. She stands and faces the cliffs and the distant horizon across the valley. Jordan is accompanied; her shoes are in her hands. The quartet stops, and the slideshow cuts to Oliver, whispering into an open mailbox near a bookstore entrance. Birds soar past Oliver towards the bookstore; others are flitting down the library steps. Oliver sips a latte as he whispers into the mailbox to Sarah. Oliver closes the mailbox and takes a swig of his latte. He gazes off into the sky, pondering, as the slideshow cuts to customers scattered together in the dining room, surrounding the television, where Greg is standing and flipping through some postcards. Ruth stands beside him, leaning against a map-covered table. The customers are murmuring, enjoying themselves; a candle flickers on the edge of the television. A young girl kneeling on a stool beside Greg is whispering animatedly with a boy who is lounging over the top of the recliner. A senior customer whispers to the young girl; another customer takes a sip of tea from a mug she'd placed on the table beside her as Greg claps and addresses the assembly. The customers chuckle appreciatively. A gentleman steps over to Greg and offers him some tea. He chuckles; the customers chuckle with him. The customers continue to chuckle; they are entertained. Greg continues to chuckle with everyone as he starts to recite poetry. A nearby gentleman applauds him with his sandwich. The toaster moves around the porch as he recites, showing the various customers, murmuring over the poetry. Some are in pairs, in quiet discussions; others listen and watch the offscreen Greg.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Jordan munches on his pretzel, and the camera tracks his foot as he kicks it into a nearby trash bin. Gospel music echoes over a bright view of the Chicago skyline and the sprawling fields of Millennium Park. The camera pans down to uncover a small group of gospel singers lounging on the broad green lawn among other tourists taking in the view. The conductor, holding some brochures, leans against a park bench a few feet away from his ensemble, whispering to someone on the other end. It's Alex, as the camera soon reveals, wearing a sleeveless jacket, a map tucked under his arm. Alex strolls away, the gospel singers still lounging and chatting on the other side of the bench. He skims through the pamphlets as he wanders, then glances upward, reflecting. Alex taps his chin as another scene appears on a black screen. A statue overlooks some wooden decking; the waves softly brush against it as Sam ambles into view, the wind tousling her scarf. She pauses and admires the water and the distant horizon across the pier. Sam is solitary; her hands rest at her sides. The sonata ceases, and the scene shifts to Pat, lounging in an open café near a park entrance. Customers bustle past Pat towards the park; others are cycling up the trail. Pat sips a smoothie as she chats on the phone to Taylor. Pat ends the call and munches on her pretzel. She gazes into the distance, grinning, as the movie transitions to visitors packed together in the den, encircling the violin, where Liam is perched and skimming through some sheet music. Gina leans nearby, propped against a book-filled shelf. The visitors are murmuring, having a good time; a lantern shines on the corner of the violin. A young girl perched on a stool next to Liam is speaking animatedly with a boy who is sprawled over the arm of the chair. An older visitor chats with the young girl; another visitor takes a sip of juice from a cup placed on the side table beside her as Liam pivots and addresses the assembly. The visitors chuckle warmly. A man walks over to Liam and hands him some cake. He chuckles; the visitors chuckle with him. The visitors maintain their laughter; they are entertained. Liam maintains his chuckles with everyone as he begins to strum the violin. A nearby man salutes him with his beverage. The camera sweeps around the space as he plays, revealing the various visitors, talking over the melody. Some are in clusters, in private discussions; others observe and attend to the offscreen Liam.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption

The camera zooms out to reveal a large group of jazz enthusiasts tapping their feet on the wide concrete patio among other New Yorkers milling about. The leader, holding some magazines, stands by a wooden railing a few feet away from his group, gesturing to someone on the other side. It's Mickey, as the camera soon reveals, wearing a long-sleeved sweater, a notebook tucked under his arm. Mickey wanders off, the jazz enthusiasts still tapping and humming on the other side of the railing. He flips through the publications as he ambles, then gazes straight ahead, contemplating. Mickey puts his hand to his forehead as another title appears on a white screen. People jog past Holly toward the bus; others are descending the station ramp. Holly chews gum as she texts to Hannah. Holly pockets the phone and takes a bite of her apple. She glances at the ground, grinning, as the film cuts to guests gathered in the kitchen, surrounding a guitar, where Evan is standing and paging through some cookbooks. Norma stands beside him, leaning against a recipe-laden fridge. The guests are murmuring, enjoying themselves; a lantern glows on the corner of the guitar. A little boy sitting on a stool next to Evan is chatting animatedly with a girl who is perched on the arm of the loveseat. An adult guest jokes with the little boy; another guest takes a nibble of cheese from a platter she'd placed on the counter behind her as Evan turns and addresses the group. The guests chuckle appreciatively. A woman comes over to Evan and hands him some cider. He chuckles; the guests chuckle with him. The guests continue to chuckle; they are engaged. Evan continues to chuckle with everyone as he starts to strum the guitar. A nearby woman applauds him with her hands. The camera moves around the kitchen as he plays, showing the various guests, whispering over the melodies. Some are in clusters, in quiet discussions; others listen and watch the offscreen Evan.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jordan nibbles on a pretzel, and the microphone tracks his foot as he kicks it away toward a distant mailbox. Jazz tunes are heard over a starry view of the Paris skyline and the blooming flowers of Hyde Park. The microphone drifts upward to uncover a small collection of mimes juggling on the cobblestone plaza among other tourists relishing the weather. The announcer, clutching some newspapers, leans on a wooden gate a few inches away from their troupe, whispering to someone on the opposite side. It's Charlie, as the microphone soon displays, wearing a winter coat, a notebook tucked into his backpack. Charlie skips off, the mimes still juggling and miming on the opposite side of the gate. He flicks through the maps as he skips, then stares sideways, contemplating. Charlie places his foot to his cheek as another subtitle flashes on a blue screen. A statue overlooks some boat docks; the breeze softly caresses them as Taylor dances into sight, the shadows casting across her coat. She twirls and faces the breeze and the nearby mountain beyond the creek. Taylor is with a crowd; her elbows are in her handbag. The opera halts, and the documentary jumps to Cameron, leaning against a closed taxi stand near a tram stop. Vehicles rush past Cameron towards the tram; others are ascending the platform ramp. Cameron munches on a pretzel as she chats on the radio to Morgan. Cameron shuts off the radio and chews on her pretzel. She glances sideways in the direction, giggling, as the show jumps to dancers packed together in the backyard, gathering around the drum set, where Jamie is lounging and sorting through some comic books. Carmen hovers beside him, reclining against a plant-covered sculpture. The dancers are murmuring, entertaining themselves; a candle flickers on the edge of the drum set. A small dog reclining on a blanket next to Jamie is barking playfully with a cat who is crouching on the rim of the hammock. A child dancer chats to the small dog; another dancer gulps a smoothie from a cup she'd left on the chair beside her as Jamie pivots and regales the troupe. The dancers chuckle heartily. A man saunters over to Jamie and hands him a smoothie. He chuckles; the dancers chuckle with him. The dancers persist in chuckling; they are amused. Jamie persists in chuckling with everyone as he starts to pound the drums. A nearby man salutes him with his dessert. The camera pans across the patio as he drums, capturing the diverse dancers, murmuring over the rhythm. Some are in duos, in discreet dialogues; others glance and observe the invisible Jamie.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Elliot takes a final drag on his cigarette before crushing it in an ashtray, as Hare Krishna music plays over a sunny view of Manhattan and Central Park. A group of Hare Krishnas dance on the lawn, while their leader, holding pamphlets, talks to Mickey, who walks off flipping through the literature. Pondering, Mickey puts his hand to his mouth as the scene shifts to Lee standing alone by the water, her hair blowing in the wind as she faces the distant skyline. The movie cuts to Holly at a phone booth near the subway, smoking and talking to Hannah. After hanging up, she smiles distantly. The film transitions to guests gathered in a living room around Evan at the piano. Norma leans against a wall of books as guests chatter and enjoy themselves. A little boy excitedly talks with a girl, while adults sip wine and engage in conversation. Evan jokes with the group, prompting laughter and cheers as he begins to play the piano, with guests toasting and chatting over the music.

talks to the little boy He laughs A nearby woman toasts him with her drink Lee is alone her hands are in her pockets The guests continue to laugh A bench faces some wharf pilings the water gently laps against them as Lee walks into view the wind blowing her hair a lamp glows on the corner of the piano Holly hangs up the phone and takes a drag on her cigarette Evan He flips through the literature as he walks then looks straight ahead pondering The guests laugh appreciatively Elliot takes a last drag on his cigarette and the camera follows his hand as he crushes it out in a nearby ashtray others listen and watch the offscreen People rush past Holly towards the subway Norma stands behind him leaning against a bookladen wall The camera moves down to reveal a large group of Hare Krishnas dancing on the broad green lawn among other New Yorkers enjoying the day Some are in clusters in private conversations they are charmed A little boy sitting in a chair next to Evan is talking animatedly with a girl who is leaning over the arm of the sofa The leader holding some pamphlets stands by a chainlink fence a few feet away from his group talking to someone on the other side another guest takes a sip of wine from a glass she would placed on the bookshelf behind her as Evan turns and addresses the group It is Mickey as the camera soon shows wearing a shortsleeved shirt a paper tucked under his arm others are walking up the station steps Holly smokes a cigarette as she talks on the phone to Hannah She looks off in the distance smiling as the film cuts to guests crowded together in the living room surrounding the piano where Evan is sitting and flipping through some sheet music Hare Krishna music is heard over a sunlit view of the Manhattan skyline and the green trees of Central Park Mickey puts his hand to his mouth as another title appears on a black screen
